bibl.title: The First Line of Euripides' Alexandros (fr. 41a K.).
bibl.note: In the fragmentary first line of Euripides' Alexandros, τὸ κλεινὸν Ἴλιον, which some have taken as nominative or vocative, is more plausibly read as an accusative of goal of motion. - Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.seg: David Kovacs, The First Line of Euripides' Alexandros (fr. 41a K.).

In the fragmentary first line of Euripides' Alexandros, τὸ κλεινὸν Ἴλιον, which some have taken as nominative or vocative, is more plausibly read as an accusative of goal of motion. - Avec résumé en anglais.
